description.S: A classic Thai noodle dish made with stir-fried rice noodles, eggs, tofu, shrimp, or chicken, tossed in a flavorful sauce.

instructions.S: Prepare rice noodles according to package instructions.
In a large wok or skillet, heat 1 Tbsp oil over medium-high heat. Add tofu, shrimp, or chicken and cook until cooked through. Move to side of pan.
Add garlic and green onions to pan and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add bean sprouts, cilantro, and peanuts to the pan and cook for about 1 minute.
In a small bowl, whisk together the sauce ingredients: vegetable oil, fish sauce, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sugar.
Add the cooked noodles, scrambled eggs, and sauce to the pan. Toss everything together to combine and heat through, about 1-2 minutes.
Top with additional lime, cilantro, and peanuts if desired. Serve hot and enjoy!

name.S: Spicy Thai Basil Chicken (Pad Krapow Gai)

description.S: Spicy and flavorful Thai dish with basil and chicken

instructions.S: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook garlic and Thai chilies in the hot oil until fragrant, about 1 minute
Add ground chicken and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until no longer pink, about 5 minutes
Stir in sugar until dissolved
Add fish sauce and soy sauce, stirring well to combine
Mix in fresh basil leaves and cook until wilted, about 1 minute
Add red bell pepper slices and cook for an additional 2 minutes
Stir in fresh Thai chilies
Pour in water and stir well to combine
In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with a splash of water to create a slurry
Stir in the cornstarch slurry to thicken the sauce
Optionally, make a well in the center of the pan and break an egg into the well, stirring to scramble and incorporating into the dish
Serve the Spicy Thai Basil Chicken over hot cooked rice

description.S: Delicious mussels cooked with celery and chili for a flavorful dish.

instructions.S: Heat oil in pan
Add mussels, celery, and chili flakes to the pan and cook until mussels have opened
Pour in white wine and lemon juice, then cover and simmer for 5 minutes
Sprinkle parsley over the cooked mussels before serving

description.S: A sweet and tropical dessert made with sticky rice and fresh mango

instructions.S: Rinse the sticky rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for at least 4 hours or overnight.
In a saucepan, combine the coconut milk, sugar, and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a gentle boil and the sugar has dissolved.
Peel and slice the mangoes. Set aside.
Toast the sesame seeds in a dry pan over medium heat until fragrant. Set aside. Spoon the warm sticky rice into serving bowls. Place mango slices on top and pour the coconut sauce over the top.
In a medium bowl, combine the tomatoes, onion, jalapeo, cilantro, lime juice, and salt.
Add the minced garlic and stir to combine.
Season with more salt to taste.
Serve immediately, or let it marinate for about 30 minutes before serving.

description.S: A flavorful South Indian condiment made with fresh coriander leaves, coconut, and spices. It is a versatile chutney that pairs well with dosa, idli, vada, or rice.

instructions.S: In a blender, add coriander leaves, coconut, green chilies, ginger, and some water. Grind to a smooth paste.
Heat oil in a small pan. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, urad dal, chana dal, and saut until the dals turn golden. Add dry red chilies, curry leaves, hing, and saut for a few seconds.
Add the ground chutney to the tempering pan. Add salt and mix well. Switch off the stove.
If the chutney is too thick, add little water and mix well. Adjust salt if needed. Serve coriander coconut chutney with idli, dosa, vada, or rice.
